lines.text:
[Homolka is eating a cake]
Mr Homolka?
Yes?
Stop eating my sesame cake.
[Homolka pauses in confusion]

[shouting angrily]
STOP EATING MY SESAME CAKE!
[Homolka spits out the cake]
What are you doing in my country, bag of shit?
Captain, please, I only wish to explore and discover...
This fellow

[pokes Homolka's face with a stick]
is a big. Bag. Of. Shit.

[to Monroe]
You should shake this RAT from off your neck. He owes money to everyone everywhere he goes. I will ask you to wait outside Mr. Homolka!
This is for you Charlie...
[zaps satellite with laser]
When the moon is like that, every monkey for 200 miles thinks he's Elvis Presley.
Robertson...
Robertson Reynolds, yeah, I fired him.
You what?
Robertson Reynolds is a bird-watcher.
I hired Robertson Reynolds!

You would! You have any idea what's going on in the Congo as of the radio show this morning? The Kigani have had it with Zaire, AND they're eating people. You go in there with Robertson Reynolds, you'll be coming out somebody's bowel movement.
So why'd you quit the CIA?
I never worked for the CIA.
Of course you didn't. But if you HAD worked for the CIA, why would you quit?
'Cause they're a loveless bunch of sons of bitches.
And you're not?
And I'm not.
Glad to hear it.
[Hormolka is poised in the doorway of a crippled DC-3, unable to jump]
Push me, please.
[Samahani shoves him with both hands, but he still doesn't move]
Harder, please.
[Samahani laughs, gets behind Hormolka, grabs an overhead rail and kicks him out with both feet]
Ugly gorillas. Ugly. Go away.
I'm your great white hunter for this trip, though I happen to be black.
Are you serving that ape a martini?
And this is your cover?
Yes
I'm nobody's cover. Cover for what?
...find yourself in the middle of something.
Cover for what?
I don't know and she won't tell you. But the kind of money her company's throwing around... they don't spend that on any gorilla. Relax. You're in better hands than you *should* be.
Stop eating my sesame cake.
[stops in mid bite, eyes wide]
Stop eating my sesame cake!
This is pure Kafka...
Who's Kafka! Tell me!
Have some, uh, coffee and cake.
[they all sit, no one partakes of anything]

[angrily]
HAVE SOME!
So, what was your name again?
Claude.
Oh. Well, that's a very odd name for someone from... uh... where are you from again?
Mbasa.
Yeah, that's a very odd name for someone from Mbasa.
Have you ever been to Mbasa?
Um, no.
Then what do you know about it?
They just blew up the president's car.
That was the president's car? Did they get him?
no, they didn't.
Aren't you human?
I'll be human later!
Name your price.
I don't have a price! I'm not a pound of sugar, I'm a primatologist!
Amy good gorilla.

[to Karen Ross]
Mr. Travis asked me to meet you at the airport, set up your expedition.
HER expedition? She's just along for the ride!
Whatever, be an asshole.
Who is this guy?
Eddie Ventro, transportation and equipment. But I don't supply assholes with new personalities.

[after Monroe pays him with two handfuls of money]
MORE.
Eddie! What happened to your head?
Customs guy, whacked me in the head with a can of peanut oil for stamping visas. I'm never goin back to that country, man. Those people have permanently wigged out!
[first lines]

[over PA system]
Doctor Ross. Doctor Ross. We've got satellite in the Congo.
What did they say, Rudy?
I can't repeat anything in here.
It's Charles.
It's Charles.

[trying her access card]
It won't work.
You changed the code already?
The old man's got me changing it every 3 hours now.
[imitating Cary Grant for voice print]
Rudy, Rudy, Rudy, Rudy.
Very inventive!
You're some kind of criminal, aren't you?
Aren't we all?
No. I'm not a criminal, I'm a scientist.
Scientist? I run a few guns. You sons of bitches ruin the world.
[last lines]

[in hot air balloon]
There's a wind.
I hope it blows us some place good.
Me too.
Quite frankly, the twentieth century sucks. Maybe the twenty-first will be better.
The ghost tribe has several levels of "dead." Someone's not dead until they're completely "dead."
That region of the Congo's uninhabited.
Well, something inhabits it.
What exactly did you see on that tape?
A camp destroyed. People dead. A grey gorilla...
There's no such thing as a grey gorilla.
Well, I saw one.
It's hard to believe at this late date...
Why are you going in there?
Geoffrey Weams, and Charles Travis, my fiance... My FORMER fiance.
Your former?
Well, we better get to him then.
Why are YOU going to Africa?
...Find something I lost.
Why teach an ape to talk?
"A lonely impulse of delight."
William Butler Yates.
Very good.
Did it work? You're not lonely anymore?
Why are *you* going to Africa?
To find something I lost...
Are you sure there aren't some kind of gorillas that kill.
Please, Dr. Ross. What's your area of expertise? Folk-singing?

[smugly]
Communications technology.
So you're a geek with a cellular phone.
I'm a scientist. But you and your protege, as far as I can see, belong in the circus.
[looks at Amy eating flowers]
Tell me you love your son!
I do!
And that's why you're sending me!
It is!
Allright. But if I have one moment, one *moment* when I think otherwise, I will make you sorry. And that's a promise.
Oh, no! The bad apes have the crystal lasers!

[as everyone on the plane prepares to jump]
Why are they putting on parachutes?
Figure it out!

[the crew members begin jumping out of the plane. Monroe hands Peter a parachure]
This isn't going to work!
Oh, yes, it is. I'll take Amy.
She might get hurt. I can't risk it!
Do you know how to fly this plane?
No.

[nods toward the cockpit, where no one is at the controls]
Well, the pilot and co-pilot are already gone, so what are you going to do?

[Handing Peter a pistol]
Here, Peter, take this.
I don't like guns.
I didn't ask if you like it - take it.
Wow, a talking gorilla! I can feel the money hairs on the back of my neck going "WOO-WOO-WOO".
When these little African countries get into a dispute, they tend to just murder everybody. They live for the opportunity to settle scores... and they have a lot of scores to settle.

[stapling shut a bag of money]
Don't want nobody peeking!

[Soldiers with guns run by]
Who are they?

[to soldiers]
Hiya fellas!
[to Karen]
Fuck if I know, and it don't pay to ask.
So Dr. Ross, I see you used to work for the C.I.A, and now you're Travi Com. Travi Com pays better than the C.I.A?
You have a BIG mouth.
Everybody says that about me!
[Elliot, visibly anxious, approaches the door of the DC3 to jump]

[laughing]
You want me to push you too?
You've got to get me out of here!
Take a number.
